> //all the stuff using prepared stmt 4 insertion

I suggest using jMock/EasyMock for this approach. Either product
(they're essentially the same, but with different API styles) makes it
very easy to make an interface, and DataSource, Connection, Statement,
PreparedStatement are all interfaces.

So if you're testing an entity bean's remove(), you can do this
(EasyMock style):

testRemove() {
dataSource = create mock DataSource
connection = create mock Connection
preparedStatement = create mock PreparedStatement
// each of these has a "control" and a "proxy"

// invoke method on proxy, saying "I expect this to be invoked"
dataSource.getConnection();

// invoke method on control, saying "here's how to respond"
dataSourceControl.setReturnValue(connection);

// proxy method... you're expecting this call
connection.prepareStatement("delete from TABLE where CONDITION");

// control method
connectionControl.setReturnValue(preparedStatement);

...

// verify all mocks were used correctly
dataSourceControl.verify();
connectionControl.verify();
preparedStatementControl.verify();
}

Do you get the idea?
